intro: Achillea fragrantissima, commonly known as sweet yarrow, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, flat-topped clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features finely divided, feather-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its fragrant foliage and showy blooms make it both ornamental and ecologically valuable.
